intro: Allantodia × yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan allantodia, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant is native to China, specifically the Yunnan province, where it grows in moist, shaded forest environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
